ej,strij101,P,pfirc901,Call at 3B Joe Stripp ejected by 1B umpire Cy Pfirman $Joe Stripp tried the hidden ball play on Spud Davis; when 1B umpire Cy Pfirman called Davis safe Stripp bounced the ball showing his disgust and was ejected by Pfirman

$The umpires originally disallowed Maranville's run as having scored during a double play. The run was credited an inning later upon further review since the last out of the inning was not a force play and Maranville scored before Worthington was tagged out.
$game called by agreement so that both teams could catch trains for the west
$the ball bounded over Snipe Hansen's head; Ethen Allen called for interference with Les Mallon, who tried to field the ball
$Shanty Hogan rounded 1B too far
$game called for rain
$Spud Davis called for interference for running into his own batted ball
$1B coach Jack Onslow called for interference with Bill Terry when the latter tried to catch the foul popup
$Travis Jackson stepped off 2B and was tagged; he was hurt on the play and taken to a local hospital for x-rays
$SPud Davis overslid 3B
$Hurst left with sinus troubles
Davis' long drive hit high off the rightfield wall.
Spectacular catch by Phillies first baseman Hurst.
$Don Hurst struck on the head
$Charlie Grimm's first game as manager
$Don Hurst left with dizziness
